lead_paragraph: FRIEDENBERG--Honorable Marilyn R. (retired) died on June 5, 2016 at the age of 89. Born in New York to Jacob and Laura Rosenfeld, Marilyn was a graduate of NYU Law School and began her legal career as a Deputy County attorney in Nassau County. She was first appointed, and later elected to the bench of the Family Court of Nassau County where she served for 11 years. She was the first female president of the Family Court Judges Association of the state of New York. She was also appointed by Governor Cuomo to serve as a Justice of the Supreme Court of Nassau County. She served as a Judicial Hearing Officer for over 20 years in both Nassau and Suffolk sitting well into her eighties. Judge Friedenberg was active in professional organizations including the American Academy of Matrimonial Lawyers and the Bar Associations of New York, Nassau and Suffolk Countries. She was President of the Nassau County Women's Bar Association and a Master Emeritus of the New York Family Law American Inn of Court. Marilyn was a trail blazer with a zest for life and learning. For 60 years she shared a special partnership with her husband Stanley (decd). They were each other's biggest supporters in a grand professional and personal life that included travel, friendships, and family. Beloved mother of Ellen Cammer (Martin) and Robert Friedenberg (JoEllen), grandmother of Jacob, Rosie, Julie, Sam and Harry and sister of Franklin Rosenfeld. A memorial service will be held at Guttermans in Woodbury on June 7, 2016 at 3:30pm. Remembrances may be made to Nassau County Bar Association's "We Care" Fund, nassaubar.org. 1/3
